fields.key: A key that should be unique to the logger prefix.
fields.duration: The duration in ms of whatever was timed.

types.description: A basic timer applied to a function.

fields.name: The name of the handler.
fields.status: Whether or not the handler resolved succesfully.
fields.duration: The duration in ms of the function.

types.description:
A timer and audit for express endpoints.
You can combine this with auth audit logs to get
a complete picture of what was authorized when.

Here, anything that is not public should have authenticated
and if it authenticated, we will tell the clientId here. Given
that, it is not necessarily true that the endpoint was
_authorized_. You can tell that by the statusCode.

fields.name: The name of the endpoint.
fields.resource: The path of the http request. Should match the one in auth audit log.
fields.method: The http method of the request. Should match the one in auth audit log.
fields.statusCode: The http status code that the endpoint resolved with.
fields.duration: The duration in ms of the endpoint.
fields.public: Will be true if the endpoint requires no scopes.
fields.hasAuthed: Will be true if the request had req.authorize() called on it.
fields.clientId: The clientId that made the request if there was one.

types.description: A timer for calls to aws services.

fields.service: The name of the aws service being accessed.
fields.operation: The specific operation of this call.
fields.duration: How long it took to resolve the request in ms.
fields.region: The AWS region this service is in.

types.description: A simple measurement. The reported values are expected to have statistics calculated over them.

fields.val: A number that should be calculated over in a time span.

types.description: A simple count. The reported values should be summed up in a time span.

fields.val: A number that should be summed over a time span.

types.description: A specifically formatted error report. Will have at least the following but can contain more.
A simple timekeeper for measuring arbitrary time spans.

fields.key: A key that should be unique to the logger prefix.
fields.duration: The duration in ms of whatever was timed.

types.description: An internal type for logging simple messages. No required fields.
An internal type for reporting malformed logging calls.
